The Big Picture was born in the imagination of Dr

Ray Emrani, as a young student in Manchester, England, began seeking a solution to the problem of simplifying and communicating large bodies of information in a way that one could easily see the relationship of the parts to the whole
Emrani began to experiment with ways of deconstructing linear information and re-representing the information as visual, linked diagrams

Later in America, for the next two decades Ray Emrani embarked upon a comprehensive program of independent research into education, cognition, memory, information design, visualization, brain structure and function, learning disabilities, psychology, interactive multimedia, and technology
His passion to find a practical alternative to linear text-based information formats resulted in a sweeping vision that has been formally organized into The Big Picture Project
James Showghy joined The Big Picture project as President / CEO to form and provide the initial and ongoing investment capital for Edutainment, Inc
The vision for The Big Picture approach to information communication, and the plan for its implementation has been 21 years in the making
This development period happens to coincide with the evolution of the Internet from a text-based network to a global network for visual, auditory and interactive communication
The underlying structure and functional flexibility of the Web provides the ideal medium for The Big Picture's unique methods of expressing information
